content.question: Which of the following statements about the skaterâ€™s motion is true?

choices.label: Her angular momentum increases when she moves to the corkscrew position because her angular speed increases.
Her angular momentum increases when she moves to the corkscrew position because her rotational inertia increases.
Her angular momentum remains the same when she moves to the corkscrew position because there is negligible frictional torque.
Her angular momentum decreases when she moves to the corkscrew position because her angular speed increases.
Her angular momentum decreases when she moves to the corkscrew position because her rotational inertia decreases.

content.answer: Her angular momentum remains the same when she moves to the corkscrew position because there is negligible frictional torque.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
